DataElement.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome Derived Expression ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A reusable, "template" description of an allowable response to a stratification criterion. EXAMPLE(S): The stratification criterion for gender can have permissible answers of male and female A character string containing a formal language expression that specifies how the observation result's attributes are, should be, or have been derived from input parameters associated with activity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome Derived Expression
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.:A combination of symbols that represents a value.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.
A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.:A combination of symbols that represents a value.

Concepts.definition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.
A combination of symbols that represents a value.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Character string datatype stands for text data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
